thread.title: Bournemouth boss Eddie Howe gets dreaded vote of confidence by Cherries chairman Jeff Mostyn
thread.title_full: Bournemouth boss Eddie Howe gets dreaded vote of confidence by Cherries chairman Jeff Mostyn

author: tsheen
title: Bournemouth boss Eddie Howe gets dreaded vote of confidence by Cherries chairman Jeff Mostyn
text:
Bournemouth boss Eddie Howe gets dreaded vote of confidence by Cherries chairman Jeff Mostyn 
Mostyn says Howe will be on the South Coast for the 'foreseeable future' By CARL LONG Comments BOURNEMOUTH manager Eddie Howe has been handed the dreaded vote of confidence. 
Chairman Jeff Mostyn stepped in to reassure the boss after the Cherries had slipped to 14th, saying the job will be his “for the foreseeable future.” Reuters Eddie Howe is in the hot seat with Bournemouth winning just one of their last nine matches Reuters 3 Cherries chairman Jeff Mostyn has given Howe the dreaded vote of confidence 
But Howe , whose side face Manchester City at home on Monday, said: “I hope I’m here longer than the foreseeable future. My heart is very much here. 
“I look forward to getting back to winning ways.” 
Howe also admitted he would “love” to sign Arsenal loanee Jack Wilshere . 
“We’d love Jack to stay, but there’s been no discussion with Arsenal,” the Cherries boss added. 
“We’re treating it as a loan for this season, as ever.” 
Wilshere admitted he’s uncertain over his future. 
“At the end of the season, when I sit down and think about [his future], that will be a big factor,” said Wilshere. Reuters Arsenal loanee Jack Wilshere is uncertain of his future RELATED STORIES TEAM NEWS Bournemouth vs Manchester City: Sergio Aguero and Claudio Bravo could both be benched again for the visitors Jack of no clubs Jack Wilshere faces crisis as 'Cherries unlikely to buy him and Arsenal cannot ensure first-team football' Lu beauty Everton 6 Bournemouth 3: Lukaku nets FOUR and grabs joint-fastest goal of season in crazy scenes at Goodison LUK-ING GOOD Everton star Romelu Lukaku scores joint fastest goal of the season so far against Bournemouth cruel blow Bournemouth striker Callum Wilson ruled out for the season with serious knee ligament injury Wenger Out? Howe, Low, Vieira... Arsene Wenger's days at Arsenal look numbered, but who should take over? B-ake for good Chelsea reject £18million Bournemouth bid for Nathan Ake, reveals Cherries boss Eddie Howe 
“I need to play, that’s why I came here. Bournemouth gave me that opportunity. 
“It’s a big time for this club. They’ve worked really hard to get to the position they are today. 
“We want to maintain our Premier League status and we know it’s going to be a big job. It’s going to be hard but we are up for it.” 
City boss Pep Guardiola, who has had problems of his own in his debut season in England, has told keeper Claudio Bravo that his exile from the team will not be permanent. 
The Chilean was axed to make way for Willy Caballero but Guardiola said: “My opinion of Claudio remains the same, he’s a top player, a top goalkeeper. 
“He’s one of the best in the world.” Eddie Howe welcomes Arsenal loanee Jack Wilshere to Bournemouth
